column3: Change the status of Mission Control findings from 'New' to 'In Progress'
column4:
- Go to Splunk Enterprise Security > Mission Control
- Group all related Findings into one Investigation (based on trigger time)
- Change the status of Mission Control findings and investigation from 'New' to 'In Progress'

column3: Identify whether the detection is False/True Positive
column4: - Check if Last hit time is over 7 days

column3: Collect additional data to analyze impacts
column6:
- Step 1: Run a search to view traffic information related to the firewall policy in the alert:
         index=* source=sc4s "policy name in inline table" 
         |table _time src_ip dest_ip dest_port dest_name src_user app action 
         |sort -_time
   => Record findings from this step

- Step 2: Check both src_ip and dest_ip:
   + If all are internal IPs => move to Step 3
   + If external IPs appear => check information and usage
       • whatismyip: identify if the IP relates to a known service in use
       • virustotal: check if the IP is clean
   => Record findings from this step

- Step 3: Identify when it occurred:
   + During working hours
   + Outside working hours
   => Record findings from this step

- Step 4: Identify other relevant info (if any):
   + User who triggered this rule (check if the user’s department matches firewall policy name/function)
         index=windows eventtype="ad-files" host="*-ad01" "username from Step 1 event" source=ActiveDirectory 
         |dedup department |table department
   + If no username but suspected user activity, check if src_ip/dest_ip belongs to a user:
         index=wineventlog host="*-ad01" EventCode=4769 "src_ip or dest_ip" 
         |dedup src_ip |table src_ip user
   => Record findings from this step

- Conclusion:
   + Check Excel file in channel Proj.BRITNEY25-SIEM Level 1 - Britney - Dormant Firewall Rule.xlsx to confirm if this firewall rule has appeared before
   + If src_ip and dest_ip are suspicious and not clean => suspicious
   + If outside working hours and the service is not a scheduled task => suspicious
   + If policy name does not match information in Step 4 => suspicious
   + <additional cases can be listed>
   => Remaining cases are normal customer activity

column3: Request system owner's confirmation or action
column4:
- Contact system owner to request verification or action if needed
- Document investigation result in Mission Control investigation

column3: Follow up actions to close findings
column4:
- Follow up on requested verification or action
- Change the status of Mission Control findings and investigation to 'Closed'
